doc.name: XMPPGateway
doc.description: This attribute sets up and maintains a connection to a XMPP server. It keeps track of actors within the model that implement the XMPPSubscriber or XMPPPublisher interface and relays messages between those actors and the XMPP server. The Executable interface is implemented merely to make sure that the connection maintained to the server is alive every iteration, before any firings occur in which actors may attempt to publish something by invoking the XMPP.publish() method. This implementation makes use of the Smack library.
doc.author: Marten Lohstroh and Ben Zhang
doc.property: The file that contains the password. If this parameter is non-empty, then it is assumed to refer to a file that contains the password. If this parameter is empty, or names a file that cannot be read, then a dialog is displayed for the user to enter the password. It is up to the user to properly protect the file from unauthorized readers by using the file system permissions. The default value is the empty string, meaning that the dialog will be displayed.
Port number to connect to. This is a integer that defaults to 5222.
Server to connect to. This is a string that defaults to "localhost".
User name to authenticate with. This is a string that defaults to "guest".
The flag indicates whether or not to enable the smack library debug If this is true, the raw XML stream will be shown for debug use. defaults to BooleanToken false
